com.samskivert.util
Class Calendars.Builder

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.util.Calendars.Builder
Enclosing class:
Calendars
public static class Calendars.Builder
extends Object

Provides fluent methods for operating on a Calendar.

Method Summary

Method Detail

addYears

public Calendars.Builder addYears(int years)
Adds the specified value to the Calendar.YEAR field. Use negative values to subtract.

addMonths

public Calendars.Builder addMonths(int months)
Adds the specified value to the Calendar.MONTH field. Use negative values to subtract.

public Calendars.Builder addDays(int days)
Adds the specified value to the Calendar.DATE field. Use negative values to subtract.

Adds the specified value to the Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY field. Use negative values to subtract.

at

public Calendars.Builder at(int year,
                            int month,
                            int day)
Sets the time to zero milliseconds after midnight on the specified year, month and day. This mirrors Calendars.at(long) for when you need e.g. a custom timezone: 
Calendars.in(zone).at(2009, Calendar.JANUARY, 1)

in

public Calendars.Builder in(TimeZone zone)
See Calendar.setTimeZone(TimeZone).

zeroTime

public Calendars.Builder zeroTime()
Zeros out the time fields of this calendar, preserving only the date.

toTime

public long toTime()
Returns the milliseconds since the epoch for our calendar's current time.

toDate

public Date toDate()
Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.

toSQLDate

public Date toSQLDate()
Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.

toTimestamp

public Timestamp toTimestamp()
Returns a Timestamp configured with our calendar's current time.

get

public int get(int field)
See Calendar.get(int).

asCalendar

public Calendar asCalendar()
Returns the wrapped Calendar instance. Note: modifications to the returned calendar will also affect this instance.
